040046.question: Hey. I've been feeling pretty terribly lately. I'm just really overwhelmed by being human- you know- the fact that you're required to go to school, and expected to go to college and if you don't you're considered a failiure, the pressure of my family to dedicate my life to school because they tell me that if I don't, I'm going to be poor. And I'm attempting to be a good artist only to fall on my face. And I try to run away from these terrible feelings through video games and I even fail at that too. So I'm going through a pretty rough time. I don't even know what to do to help myself. But thank god it's nighttime. I can't stand the daytime because I'm surrounded by an environment that I hate and whenever I open my eyes I can see every single inch of it. I guess to comfort myself in these times I just go underneath my blankets and distance myself from the world and type to you. I just really want to feel better but I don't know how. Actually, I'd feel a lot b etter if I knew that I can succeed in the future without college and if I could be comfortable talking to my parents about my feelings. And i had a car so I can just leave my house and distance myself from everything I hate about this world. I think that's how I can truly be happy you know- being confident in the future and in yourself. I'm a bit hesitant to go all in and have a whole bunch of confidence that if I get better at art I'll be all set in life. I mean even if I'm wrong, I might as well try, right? It's better than just sitting here extremely afraid and sad. And i feel like I can learn a lot from it all- I mainly think that being good at art would be what makes me joyous and feel fulfilled in life because I love expressing myself. But if I can express myself in a more moving and beautiful way like through music and drawing, I think I'll have a blast. I can express myself in ways that have never been done before. But I have to learn first. I have to get really good and experienced to be able to express myself through song the way I want to. So maybe I can type out my feelings in the meantime you know? And still continue to learn the mechanics but still express myself. And then when I get to the point where I'm super confident in my ability, I'll attempt to express my deep feelings through music. Music is my main goal. I'm going to listen to some music before going to sleep. Bye.
040046.answer: a large percentage of the world's most successful people dropped out of college or didn't go i think you may get better results if you think more in terms of strengthening your force field, rather than trying to escape. i think if you escape in a car you may feel trapped in a car. cars are small. if you need to leave, you can walk ... sometimes that feels better than driving anyway actually sometimes the most true and powerful expressions occur before you have barely learned anything. and at the same time, no amount of experience will ever be enough to express anything 'perfectly' unless you adopt the view that everything is perfect (which is a fine view) in which case that's great news because that means anything you could possibly do would be perfect even if it wasn't quite what you were expecting (kind of like people) if you are waiting for 'confidence' before 'attempt' you might be doing this backwards

040071.question: I'm just going to talk about how I feel when I try to express myself through art and how I struggle sometimes. So haha this is going to be stupid. But I stare at a blank piece of paper and then my mind just goes blank and then I'm like "how the fuck am I supposed to express my feelings through a pencil? Do I create a new character?" And then I freeze up and my mind freaks out like this: jdgdhsjshshsjsj and I stop at the idea of a character and I'm like ahhhhh. And now I realize how stupid I've been. I should just doodle and not give a fuck about what happens. Just express it- even if it isn't clear. And I've been so scared to do something wrong because I want to be so much like the other people I look up to that are able to create cool stuff. But if I look at how I'm feeling at the moment, It doesn't even feel right to make "cool stuff" it feels right to express my anger and fear and confusion. And with music it's sorta similar- I can improvise sometimes and I love the way I'm able to do it. And other times I just mess up and just struggle and freak out again like ahsbsbdhddhdh yeah I'm not perfect at all. But pfft atleast I'm looking at how stupid I am and realizing how stupid I am. Yeah bill sorry for being stupid. I vent on here and I look back and I'm like holy shit I was really really fucking stupid. Ha. Ok I'm going to take my advice now and make some art that's kinda stupid but honest if that makes sense. Bye.
040071.answer: no, something much simpler. like start by putting a dot on the page and that's all you're allowed to do, but the one freedom you do have is you can choose anywhere on the page to put the dot. really try to go wild with that one decision. then put a time stamp on it and call it a day. i think you will be amazed at how many unique locations there are for just 1 dot. really makes you think about the shape and size of the page doesn't it. bonus, see if you can find a crazy place to put the date everyone is stupid. it's fun

040093.question: have you ever experienced something like having your emotions shut off? i am getting very frustrated because i love(d?) music and art and life so much but now all my favorite songs feel empty. all i get out of them are vague recollections about what they were supposed to have made me feel, rather than the actual feelings themselves. this is making me feel disgusted and it is making me feel a great sense of loss because i wanted to be a musician and i guess i still want to be but i can't feel anything positive. when i play something i can't tell if it's good or not because i can't tell if i'm creating the feeling i want or not because i can't feel the feelings. am i going to spend the rest of my life without feeling the joy of music ever again? i really don't want this to happen to me. what if i'm doomed to be like this forever. i can feel boredom, loneliness, and crushing hopelessness, and that's pretty much it. maybe i'm depressed. am i depressed? i can sort of feel amused but that's not the same thing as like real joy and happiness. i really miss the feeling of awe.i used to look at the sky and the clouds and the stars and feel so much awe. why are my feelings so broken. it's like everything i cared about is now so far away. it seems like you like to suggest walking for dealing with crappy feelings, and that indeed used to be my go to method as well, but even walking feels empty. what can i do? i'm sad. also am i being overly dramatic? i hate being that one person who can't deal with their shit as well as most other people and then goes off and complains about how bad their life is. but i really don't know what to do. thanks for reading bill.
040093.answer: not usually, but there is a continuous rotation that occurs, usually if you think something has 'shut off' it's actually just rotated or shifted slightly, and you need to adjust to the new configuration time to find some new ones it's time to find some new songs no that is unlikey not necessarily try something completely brand new according to Drama, and its Respectable Limits you are averaging about 3.2 a good next step would be imagining how you want your life to be. there are many different steps after that but that is the first step

040116.question: So I'm going to tell you something. I have this problem that I experience sometimes where I don't want to do something like art. But all the people I look up to are artists and I want to be like them. So then I don't want to do it. But I try to pressure myself to do it and here's why. Im in high school and I don't want to go to college because school has depressed me and made me go insane and I feel like I have to prove to my parents that I have a special skill or something so that they'd be okay with me not going to college. Because I see you- and it looks to me that you've had your awesome music skills since you were like a kid (I know I could be wrong just correct me or something) and you seem to be pretty successful for not going to college. So then I think I have to do the same thing. And a whole bunch of other people I look up to have also developed their awesome passions at a young age and I feel like I have to do the same. So I'm stuck between this thing of wanting to do artistic stuff right now to help prepare me for the future (even though I don't want to do it at the moment) and doing the things that make me happy even though they're kind of pointless like reading books or playing video games or watching movies. But to be honest, my interests shift by the second. I play video games for a little bit, and then I want to write. So... I have plenty of interests really. They just shift throughout the moment. And here's what I'm thinking: I think I should do the stuff I want to do right now and be concious of what my wants are. And keep shuffling around them accordingly to suit what I want at the moment and just kind of look at my wants and see what happens over time. But be concious of how I'm feeling. Sometimes I think I'll want to do art stuff but other times, I won't want to. But the reason why I'm doing this is to help myself just be myself in the best way. Sometimes I'll do stuff I don't want to do and force myself to do it. So I want to keep myself in check. And ask myself, "do I really want to do this right now?" and act accordingly instead of just kind of neglecting what I actually do want. And over the course of this I'll get to know myself better while freely being myself. For whatever reason, I think this'll be fun. Sorry if this was a bit confusing. I'm just trying to organize myself a bit and typing to you helps me get better at this stuff for some reason. So I'll see you man. I think I'll let you know how it goes.
040116.answer: it took a long time. i turned down most of the normal routes and insisted on doing everything from the inside out, in my own way, while also getting deeply lost in the jungle on purpose to do it the way i did it you might want to get a very humble yet steady job that seemingly has nothing to do with your prefered 'field'. this is so as to not distract you from inventing it, and also buy you some time to really get it right yes yes good that sounds ferociously fun

040125.question: i have a question. i think you said you are concocting your next song to work without bass, or that you were recording bass last in order to make sure it is still strong without bass. something to that effect. does that mean bass was central to your other recordings? cause i listen to a lot of your songs thru my phone speakers and they still sound good to me, i dunno if my question makes sense. i'm just wondering how you would make sure it sounds strong without the bass, because i feel like everything you make is already strong without bass
040125.answer: not necessarily but it's gotta be a big deal i've presumably snuck by just by the seat of my pants. they're not written for bass, or as bass songs, they're just written as song songs, but a bass player secretly knows that any song is actually the best place for the bass to have a hot ball it's something i've been too scared to think about. but when i saw all my stuff doing so well on vine, i just sort of blindly and superstitiously accepted the fact that a large percentage of the audience was bassless and i was scared to think about it. for example many of those like "stronger videos" is going crazy on bass, but fortunately it gets by ok, again i'm sure this is largely because nothing was written with the bass in mind. all the bass fun is like 'bass player' fun (not writer) in that it's all after the song has been written, and those bass elements come from the player not the writer. song was already written before if that makes sense. like i said it was scary doing it blind but one day i just decided if this is actually where the music is being heard i need to actually hear it at some point. so i made an EQ setting to match the sound of a tiny bassless speaker and i can click it on any time, i call it the iphone simulator. and i recommend everyone should check this frequently especially at the very very beginning of your arrangement, what the hell even leave it on for long periods of time, especially at the beginning of the process. like making a compelling 3d drawing which has to look good in 3d but half your audience will only see it in 2d so it has to look great in 2d too. you're better off starting in 2d, because if you start in 3d it will be too easy to make it 3d because anything looks 3d automatically, and then when you flip it to 2d it could be garbage. where as if you start in 2d, you'll be forced to figure out how to make it look 3d even on the 2d system. if you do that you'll be way ahead of the game. then flip it to 3d and then add all the extra crazy things in 3d which won't mess up the 2d

040160.question: when i try to organize what i mean to say in a structured, presentable way, i just end up cutting out the meaning. it's hard to tell what the core of importance is when trying to shuffle everything around until it reads like something that 'makes sense'. or maybe it's that when i feel the pressure to do this, i didn't get a chance to decide what i mean, it was imposed on me either by some Authority or my own self thinking it's absolutely necessary. then it's a fight to figure out what makes sense, what makes sense to me, what's going to make sense to whoever's going to see it, and that's hard to tease out especially with a real or even imagined deadline. i get caught up in teasing it up all nice, and it might carry some of the right meaning, but it's severely watered down or the real big points are underdeveloped in favor of presentability. and it's not exactly that i'm consciously trying to make it fake. it's endlessly second-guessing what's strong and what's not when i can delete and rephrase as much as i want. the reason rambling beginning-to-end with no edits works is because it's just everything that goes through my head, which is as real and close to my thoughts as anything...becuase... you know, they're my thoughts. how did that not occur to me? i can't believe myself. well. at least i know now. rumor has it that i'm a rotten person and everyone knows it. hmm. that's quite a jump. well it's not if you show the thread of thought that connected those things. which i forgot to do because i was busy thinking. or i was thinking about that before. or the parts that would make that make sense somehow fell through the filter. i don't know. i don't know i don't know asdfasdf dfjkdfjkdjfkdfj there's been no editing of this. it's beginning to end. it's not . that. bad. i.dont.know.anymore. why? do i focus. fucking focus fucking focus. what is your point? what is the point? what are you feeling? are you just stuck on the words that you're typing? is that taking over your mind in favor of what you're trying to actually get across? and why do you have to do it here? why? do you ? do this? i don't like that i do this. why not? because i do it wrong a lot. & nbsp;&nb sp; what's wrong? being fucking embarrassingly awful and terrible and maybe even gross. okay. you do it right sometimes? yes. i guess. okay. what is the difference between a time you did it 'right' and a time you did it 'wrong'? i forgot to have a point. i just talked to talked. i had feelings, sure, but being caught up in OMFG THIS HAS TO GET DONE AND IT HAS TO GET DONE RIGHT ruins it. you know what a big part of this is? this is how they teach you to write in school, conveying information in the standard, structured way. it can work if you're trying to convey plain information, and maybe you can learn to do it up all nice so it's not Boring As Fuck, but when you're writing what's on your mind the points are what's on your mind. and editing what's on your mind is editing out the actual meaning of those thoughts and feelings. how did that not occur to me? okay. i think i'm getting somewhere. i think. but what else? you forgot the part where you felt hurt. i felt hurt because i made and continue to make people uncomfortable when i be myself and i try to be better but i can't figure out how to BE because i am not a good be-er in the first place which makes it hard to figure out how to adjust your be-settings. what is be? well be is me. i guess. and what don't you like about you? that i'm so self-absorbed that it blinds me from seeing when i'm being ridiculous and broadcasting my ridiculousness and it's not that i'm all bad but i'm pretty bad why do you have to be so mean to yourself? because that's what i was taught to do. i guess. if you could forgive yourself, do you think you could find the strength to be as good as you can be and improve? i just don't understand. i don't know anymore. this is supposed to be fun. it's been fun but lately i've forgotten about having fun. for the most part i did a long time ago. this is as close as i get to that. and i just don't want to let go of it. because then i'll have nothing. and i did have nothing for a while. why. why why why why why why. why. why. why. why. why. why. why. why. why. bother. why. bother. why do you have to bother people. but i have to try a little harder than this, right? how do i be clear without being fucking bonkers? there's a lot of circumstances where that's not going to work. okay, here's my point :: i am sorry for any discomfort that i may have caused. i'm trying to try in the right way but i'm not exactly good at that. i want people to feel better for having interacted with me. i'm not good at that. i'm trying to learn how to do that. i guess that's it. i guess, outside of having fun. i'm trying to figure out how to be a human. this is probably far from the best way of doing that, but if it wasn't already clear, i am a severely confused person who just doesn't understand that sort of thing. but i desperately want to know how to not suck
040160.answer: yes that's normal i have not heard that rumor this is to make sure you don't get too good. otherwise you may start your own awesome school and steal all their customers that's true evidence? it's important to realize that the reason you put so much pressure on yourself is because it means very very much to you to be the absolute best best thing possible. you have high standards because you are the leading authority on best-ness. at least that's the way it appears from the way you are approaching this they might like it seems like you already have the try dial just about set to max if you want to be clear, simplicity is always your friend. another great strategy to try when writing something for an audience if you are trying to make sure it is 'perceived' well: run-thrus. run through/read through the product in real time, after clearing your mind totally. so clear your mind totally (this works best if you do your read-throughs after doing something completely different for a while but not everyone has that kind of time) my trick that i use is i walk over and touch the door handle and return to the desk and do a timed run-through. this is the most clear way of seeing exactly how it is going to play out from the audience's perspective then after the run through you can try to recall vividly exactly which parts got you most excited and which parts didn't. and, what to do next. you will see this most clearly during the run through or in the 5 seconds after. capture your notes very quickly, and try to ascertain all that you felt about the run through. then make the necessary changes, if any, and get ready to do another run-through. sometimes you will take some notes but you are still not sure what to change, then the moment of clarity fades. that's ok. re-set and do another run through you might want to make your own personalized custom way. that's how some of the pros do it one of the best things about 'humans' is how damn different and unique each one of them can be. it sounds like your best bet here is to make up your own way. you seem to have exactly the drive and focus needed to do that i think you already figured that out a while ago

040230.question: Was it weird making Hallelujah, because of its differences (in terms of mix) from your recent songs?

040242.question: ive been staying at home all summer and making music, and it's been a pretty good time. my parents used to be really discouraging over me pursuing music but now they seem to have somewhat accepted it. anyways the only issue is that ive been working on a lot of stuff (producing songs + film scoring on logic pro w my new midi controller) but my parents seem very disinterested in seeing what i've been working on all summer and it makes me feel kinda sad. i get validation through my friends and even my siblings tell my parents that it seems like i really found a passion and am making some cool stuff, but they haven't once asked to see my stuff, and it doesn't really affect my desire to do what i wanna do, but it just makes me kinda sad. should i try harder to open up my music to my parents and show them this part of me or should i accept that they don't rly care and focus on the people who do

040284.question: hey so im practicing with a metronome and it's just stupendous. i'm at a place where i can totally foresee results beyond anything in my wildest dreams. my question is, is it better to deal with whatever problems i have with that tempo AT that tempo? or should i go back 15bpm and work back up to it? i did the latter for the past couple of days and it didn't feel like i was actually improving at that tempo. but hey, i also leave for a couple hours and come back better for no reason so maybe that is making me better in ways i don't understand. it would just help to know im in a somewhat right direction.
040284.answer: the trick is to start at a very slow tempo, slow enough so you can get it right 10 times in a row. when you get it right 10 times in a row, increase by 1bpm. only 1. then when you get it right 10 times in a row, increase by 1 more

040317.question: So most of these songs come from what you've already written in late 2000s - early 2010s, I assume. Are you picking these by order of when you wrote them, or do you do by random/what looks most appealing?
040317.answer: in 2012 i learned how to update/finish/fix. and i did that nonstop throughout 2012 and 2013 and later. that makes it an entire catastrophe just to fiture out even when a song was written. it's well documented but most songs have multiple dates they were worked on. so it wouldn't even be possible to figure out that order. i have used brute force randomization, but more renctly i've been using a hybrid semi-randomization, where i make manual exclusions and then randomize amongst the finalists. also in the last 2 years i have allowed myself to pick fragments, which means the majority will be current writing (outside, movie star, got to know what's, etc)

040540.question: Today I found myself watching YouTube videos all day, afraid to do anything besides that. I do have feelings of discomfort like that- which makes it hard for me to do activities that seem a bit scary to me even though it's all in my head. But today was the first time I had actually stooped so low in a very very long time. I was procrastinating on these two simple tasks I told myself to fulfill. Prior to playing my keyboard, I wanted to inspect my approach to music and perhaps change it. And I wanted to draw something original because I find that so scary. Both tasks were scary to me- playing the keyboard and drawing something original. The reason why playing the keyboard to me is scary is because my mind numbs to it and I find it harder to innovate. This makes me feel bad because it makes me feel like an insecure failiure. Drawing something original scares me because I'm the past I've found it to be quite a stress enduring task because I judge my wor k so har shly, I find it difficult to lift myself off the ground and persue an idea because I want it to be so perfect so bad. So both tasks are pretty stress enducing and my procrastination and fear got the best of me. It makes me feel sad. But... procrastinating felt so good that I'm confused to this whole situation. I came to the conclusion this morning that my approach to art was causing unnecessary stress and if I change my approach, art is bound to be more fun for me. But I pussied out! Because I was back in my stupid house that I hate being in and I found it to be so overwhelming I didn't even dare to try. Dammit I'm fucking retarded. ...why is it so hard for me to do this? It honestly upsets me. Oh my god I'm so sorry! I'm apologizing to you and me. Fuck- I could've been out there doing something amazing and getting over these fears but fuck no! All I thought about were those crippling feelings I got out of my past attempts. Ohhhh this is the first time in the past couple day s that I 've actually been this upset. Fuck you tat! Fuck fuck fuck fuck you for being so scared and fuck you for being so unable to change you fucking retarded bitch! Why can't I fucking change myself to actually be the person I dream of??? AAUUGHHHHHHHHHH IM MAD IM MAD IM MAD but you want to hear something? My mind doesn't feel overworked or upset at my dumbass!!! I feel like a piece of shit. You know what? I'm done. Fuck it. I'm going to that damn room and I'm going to create something beautiful. I'm done with this fucking bullshit of sabatoging myself. My punishment for not persuing my fears is to make myself uncomfortable facing my fears. I find that thought quite hillarious for some reason. Anyways I'll be back. Im about to fucking whip my ass and I forgot what other bullshit I was going to say I'm so mad right now BYE
040540.answer: if there is a particular thing you want to accomplish, this is one weird trick i've learned, do it at the very beginning of the day after a very short walk. wake up, very short walk and visualize what you think you intend to do with the day and immediately do it. if you take control of the first hour of the day, the rest of the day falls into your pocket. it's the weirdest thing

040555.question: i feel like i'm AWFUL at music related crap ghjghgjhd i really love music but like. i know literally nothing about how to make things Good and i only have garageband for my fricking iphone which is really tedious to use and i just end up getting frustrated and give up. sure people can actually make good stuff with garageband on their phones but i feel like i'm not one of those people + i'm not patient with myself so i just end up smashing the keys on the piano and make nothing. at least nothing good, or nothing i end up keeping. i make a beat and then i listen to it and i realize that it's Garbage!!!!!!!!!! i want to make cool songs, i really do, but i don't know if that's really what i should be spending my time doing; which on another note, i don't know if i should actually spend money to learn how to play the piano or if i should figure out a way to teach myself because i'm having a very hard time understanding the piano and sheet music and what keys are what and what chords are what and what things fricking mean and i'm FBDSHBDFSBSD i just want to make cool music but it's all so complicated and hard for me. i don't know if i should stop trying or not. should i give up? should i just go back to making drawings that may or may not be any good? that seems to be the only thing i actually know anything about ... i enjoy it for the most part but i've recently wanted to do Other Things, like music, but i don't know if it's worth trying or if i even have the potential in the first place to do it? i know nothing! is it too late for me? i'm still "a kid" but i'm not the ideal age of where people start doing music related stuff? like idk most people who are good at piano and stuff started when they were like 5 or something and i am Not 5 so ehwbtfgdsjgsjdjgfsdjhgsj this is word vomit i'm sorry i just don't know what to do or if i should even do anything
040555.answer: a big part of this is whether your keyboard knows the difference between when you smash hard and when you smash soft. phones don't have this, so if you just get even a very small midi controller keyboard, and hook it to your phone and use that. the loud/soft note thing is a big deal. if you don't have that you're gonna have a bad time the only thing you should be spending money on is a keyboard that knows the difference between a hard and soft note. all keyboards do except toy ones and even some of the toy ones can do it i think if you get yourself a keyboard that can tell the diff between a hard and a soft note that will put you way ahead of the game. for example, even if you never learn what note is what you can still make great rhythmic things happen on 1 note. but if your keyboard doesn't have loud/soft then you're gonna have a bad time

040605.question: I like how you have HUGE expectations for yourself and the quality of your work and yet are still super productive. like, you don't seem to buckle under your own pressure. have you ever struggled with putting so much pressure on yourself that it impaired your ability to work? or are you just great at handling your own pressure? do you have any advice on how to not be *so* hard on myself with my own expectations that I just... completely collapse?
040605.answer: no. the problem is there's not enough pressure. that's what really impairs my work, is not enough pressure i can't seem to figure out how to make it strong enough actually i'm not sure if you are talking about time or quality. i was thinking you meant time. i naturally assume that everything has to be as good as possible. but actually i've found, shockingly, that this is an entirely nebulous benchmark. so the product will evaporate if you try to spend too much time on it. many people find that they do much stronger work under time pressure

041032.answer: you should try a touch typing position. your right 4 fingers rest on jkl;. your left 4 fingers rest on asdf. each finger also takes what is immediately above and below= qwer zxcv uiop m,./ and the index fingers split the middle ones (left has rtgbv and right has uyhnm) thumbs have the space. just start typing this way and within like 2 days you will be just fine. and you absolutely don't have to look at the keyboard to do it

041102.question: when you are writing a new song, how do you keep track of lyrics and form? i know you record all the audio but for like doing run through and building each section do you write anything down, or just listen back to what you played/sang to memorize it?
041102.answer: i used to write the chart on staff paper but i no longer use any paper. i use a text file and audio recordings. the lyrics are written in the text, and next to each line (maybe every 2 lines or every 4 lines) there is the file name of the audio reference. when the song is done you might often see a file name at the top of the page for a full run thru. then often when starting the arrangement, i will whip up a "studio chart" (really just chords) based on the run-thru, and put it on paper just to have something on the stand to look at in the empty beginning stages of the arrangement. but pretty soon as things get filled in i wouldn't need it anymore because it's all in there. and then when doing vocals i may type up a lyric cheat sheet. sometimes i may reference the demo run-thru if i want to confirm what the exact melody was

041160.question: hi Bill, i have problems with singing high notes. right now lowest i can go is C#2 and highest i can go succesfully is C4. i want to sing above that but after C4 i feel like i'm straining my voice.
041160.answer: there's a weird and cool technique you can do. actually there's 2. one is keep your head pointing straight forward. sometimes you think you want to sing the note up. you don't need to do that. sing it straight across even if it's high. but the other really crazy trick, this is a psychological trick, pretend you are singing down to the note. pretend it's not the highest note you can sing. pretend it's a low note and sing down to the note. like pretend you can sing way higher and sing down to it. here's another trick, this one comes from tony robbins, just close your eyes and imagine yourself singing the note clearly and beautifully. just visualize it happening, 10 times in a row. now try it. these are all interesting tricks. but don't forget to warm up before doing high notes and don't push hard, and if it hurts don't do it

041213.question: I have to learn the baseline of the song "runaround sue" by dion for my acapella group, and when I'm with the group I remember the musical notes, but when I go home I can only think of the melody and then I can't practice my part. Any suggestions?
041213.answer: get a playalong version, with a count off. record one. you could record one with the group, count it off and have them sing it through without you. then you'll have something to practice to. or if you are adept you could record your own, part by part. make sure to use a steady click, good count-in, and a good pitch reference especially for the first one. what the hell, use pitch correction to save time and make it the most solid to practice to

041230.question: No such thing as an objective truth--- or at least there is as much objectivity in our universe as there is subjectivity--- Our realities are bounded by our sensory abilities and as everything in the universe is defined by the laws of cause and effect, we can assume that for all things and non-things (and things in-between things and non-things), a set path of event-to-events is in place as far as our perception of reality allows. I.e. if the exact circumstances that caused the creation of our universe were to reoccur in the exact same way, then every following time-related outcome would be identical. Every life, death, thought, personality, choice, etc. is predetermined, like an elaborate Rube Goldberg machine with a few of the components trying to rationalize their place in the whole thing. At the end I'm betting on nothingness, but hoping for something cooler. Like a controlled rewind button with godmode or to wake up in the fourt h dimens ion having finished this low budget 3-d rpg. Hell, a dollar store deity would at least offer some irony. I'm not that creative. Probably gonna be something beyond the pink squish in my heado. What do you think?

041232.question: oh, now i get it. i come here and start talking to myself. forgetting to communicate. just thinking to self. forget to cut the thread until i realize how long it's gone. first i thought it needed to keep going because i hadn't made my 'point' yet. there's not a special point. it's just that if you keep thinking what you mean more meaning will be there and at the end there will be a wide horizon of truth and you look out at it and see something at some point that feels like 'it'. it can be cut off at any point. you realized that. but then you figured, well, if it can stop now, it can also continue. then i'll Really have some points!.. nah. it's just a window of insanity. insanity can carry meaning. wait, what's insanity? you think of it as disjointed from reality. rambling, sprawling, the focus tumbling forward and out and everywhere. it's inevitable that it catches on something important if you can still see that through the mess. &n bsp;&nbs p; messy. messy? it's messy without focus. no filler allowed. what is the filler? how do i know which words are the fluff? the fluff diverts the focus. what is the focus? how do you know? you don't know when you do this. you're just thinking. you're just thinking. you're just thinking. you're just thinking. oh no. i didn't come here to do this. i came here to be focused. focus. use your 10. not your 2. this is the lab. yes. it's the lab. you can do anything in the lab. but you have to have a plan. the plan can be to have no plan. but that needs to be a choice. not your always. what you need is to distill the meaning. add fun, stir, enjoy. but don't waste time. [] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] [ PAST THIS NOTICE, THERE WILL BE FOCUS. SCRATCH THE TANGENTs. EVERYTHING HAS A TANGENT. TUG ON EACH VINE, SURE. BUT YOU KEEP THE STURDIEST AND CLIP THE REST*. ] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] () () ( ) () () () () ( *bonus points : weave them around the main vine in a way that makes it sturdier. ) () () () () () () () if you want to communicate, and you do, you need to have a point and it needs to be understood, and the process of the end-consumer understanding it needs to feel easy and good. that can be difficult to gauge when it's your own thoughts. you may confuse articulating your thoughts as they appeared as making them understandable to others and the contact high from having just recently handled the spicy crazy fun with having made something that is fun to experience as a separate person. what you need is to learn how to see the end product as a separate person. that's a different suit. you gotta be you when you're doing it, or what the hell is it gonna be? what i'm doing right now is tricking my brain into going into communication mode while in a mostly-safe environment. i feel i'm gaining a better understanding of what' s going on here. most of that information comes from doing it wrong. the next step is to become comfortable doing this in a completely independent environment, learn to accurately evaluate performance, and plan the appropriate next steps + the upcoming destinations + the long-term journey. the obvious next step is to try some fiction. stories. deliberate things that don't have your immediate thoughts tied up into it. that's great practice for fun, clear, purpose-driven communication. extra bonus, if you come up for air and feel ready to express yourself in a straightforward way, you'll be even better at communicating and you'll have new things to say. ew. what happened here? diplomat mode has no heart. passion mode has no feet on the ground. that's not even passion on the top. that's a beaten bastard hybrid child. or maybe it's fine. ish. it's nothing new. the lessons are settling in. i don't know if i'll ever figure this out.
041232.answer: sounds like you are getting the hang of it

041233.question: theory for music is like theory for language: if it doesn't help you, either change it or let it go. if it does help you, keep it. theory is also like a dick: it's not innately bad, but a lot of people who have a GRASP of it may still have stupid ideas about how it should be used, like only for tedious and pointless DRILLING instead of as a flexible tool for everybody's consensual pleasure. do you agree with these comparisons?

041238.question: Loving the new song. Probably one of my favorite songs of yours. I love the fact that you completed it in just two weeks and there's nothing I would change about the song, but what about you? If you had just a few days more to work on it, what would you have added/improved?
041238.answer: the mix didn't get the same level of attention as it did in the previous songs. there's probably too much of a general bulge around 200hz. to fix that you just have to crawl thru every instrument and figure out what to cut, and when. actually on the last 2 songs i went through the vocal and made very specific eq cuts custom to each word. it made a big difference especially for the car, because the car system is very volatile and sensitive. i didn't have time to do any of that. but, i did do what's absolutely necessary. in fact, when you have limited time, sometimes you resort to arrangement changes if something is not working. for example, the "not gonna happen" section was muddy and lumpy as hell, and normally i probably would have gone crazy cutting frequencies from vocals, background vocals, instruments, really just slaved over it. but instead i went back in and just added some drums, made some quicker fixes which might have had more impact. the important thing is, if you stay working on it too long, self doubt starts to set in

041246.question: Do you have advice for someone who is deathly scared of accidental plagiarism?
041246.answer: i would say google it but really i don't think you should. if you google anything relatively small and simple, you will probably find someone else who has said it before. this will make you doubt yourself away from doing it, when really it's probably fine. it could be a really obscure mention you just found. i think you should think what you want and say what you want. in plagiarism court cases, they are supposed to prove access, and prove that you have seen or heard the thing. so if you really said what you said without seeing or hearing the thing, then you should be ok. you also don't get in any trouble unless the thing you are doing gets really famous. so in that way you can use 'murphy's law' in your favor

041367.question: could you describe your mastering process? which things (compression, multipression, eq automation, limiting) do you do, in what order? are there any examples of you using an effect on the stereo out track? one time i did a reverb freeze going into the bridge and man that was powerful. any nifty tips on efficiency or making it sound so damn freakin crisp and wonderful? thanks
041367.answer: listen to to the track and then listen to a professional modern pop song and then contemplate suicide for a while and then pick myself up and then try to fix some things, i guess i'm still figuring out the system, i got a lot more detailed on the last 3 songs (except the most recent one) and then suddenly i decided to start doing them in 1/4 of the amount of time, so a lot of that has gone out the window, which is good because it makes you gravitate toward the most important things. not usually but that could be useful i recently learned to group things to aux's. i should have learned that much sooner but i learned it recently. it's very good for doing reverb, and automating reverb. automating reverb opens a whole new door to fun times one weird weird thing i noticed, i was mixing hallelujah for way way too long and feeling trapped and down about it, listening to 'new rules' side-by-side with it and just wanting to die over it, (by the way this was just days before i found out the loudness war is officially over. so now we don't have to worry about that which is huge huge news, but this was right before i realized that) anyway, i had done all this work on the mix for hallelujah, and it's also just a really dense and layered textural arrangement, etc, and whatever, and then i was poking around for reference songs (such as new rules and several other songs done by other people) and was generally freaking out about how much clearer everyone else's songs sounded but (i'm getting to the point of this, hold on) here's the surprise: i accidentally opened up one of my jazz jam sessions (like anything you would hear on the 'jazz' section of this site) and i was shocked to find out that that recording sounded so much more clear, sounded like it was mixed much much better, but as we all know it is not even mixed at all. those are instrumental jams where i lay down each instrument in 1 crazy take, bounce it out and call it a day. and the point is, i found out that that mix (which was no mix) had a lot more punch and clarity than this hallelujah mix which i had so tenderly spent so many long days on. the lesson was , ...... if you use a million instruments it is a real challenge to mix it out of sounding like mud. even if it's very tenderly layered and arranged instruments, the point is, if there are many instruments, they will clog up the mid range, like that troublesome 100-300 range. but if you use only 3 or 4 instruments, ..... it's just got automatic clarity. so that's something. so this works to my advantage now working under these crazy deadline schedules, because i simply don't have time to make as dense an arrangement, and it is therefore easier to mix. Another thing i learned, on the subject of working faster, is, ... work faster. you gravitate toward what matters. and it is so easy to lose your mind if you listen to that damn thing for too long. you'll just lose your mind ...... another way to get tips is watching a billion mixing tutorials and tips videos until you realize they are all starting to contradict each other, and then you forget it and do what you want

041836.question: what is a power chord
041836.answer: you know how a major chord has one note different from a minor chord .... well a 'power chord' is when you don't play that note at all. just the 1 and 5. probably has the most 'power' when it's played on guitar with some distortion, in low range with another octave on top. so low E, B, E. or G, D, G. used all the time in distorted guitar music because major/minor intervals start to crap out when the distortion comes on, and also don't work in the low range. 'power chords' seem most at home in a reasonably low range, around the low area of a guitar. not to be confused with 'power cord' which provides electricity for the chord

041837.question: So, I'm really getting into composing (mainly in Ableton Live), and I've discovered that I naturally gravitate toward writing instrumental music. If I had to describe my music, I think I'd call it programmatic. I try to write vocal music sometimes, but I freeze up when it comes to writing the actual vocal melody. Now, this wouldn't be so weird, if I myself wasn't a vocalist. How can I spend so much time around vocal music, and yet not be able to write any myself? What the hell is wrong with me?
041837.answer: what might be helpful is to get the writing done outside of the program. just get some paper or text, and your favorite playable instrument. write what you want to write, then once you know fully how it goes then go into the program and start putting it together according to the road map. if this still doesn't work then i recommend spending some quality time with the words alone. open a text file or blank piece of paper and go bananas for a few months

041901.question: Shaming folks for finding coping methods that work for them is bullshit and that's what you're doing when you work out your loathing of psychiatry on the questions page. I don't know your back story
041901.answer: yes you do, if this is who i think it is, you're the one who's been stalking me for several months now and I don't know you, but based on what you've said over the years, I'm guessing people (family?) forced "help" on you when you were younger to try to get you to conform to some shit ideal they had for who they wanted you to be. I'm very sorry that happened. That's not fucking okay. Sure, you're eccentric and unique and innovative and genius and "weird"... and as long as you're happy and you're not hurting anyone, you should be able to do and be and live whatever and however the fuck you want. Always. Period. I will fight til the death for your right to be as free and insane as makes you happy. But your needs and experiences aren't everyone's needs and experiences. Some people need therapy and meds to achieve basic functioning and baseline peace or to tak e care o f their kids or to take care of themselves or whatever the fuck it is that they need to do in this life... and I am clearly one of them. And when you think you're just hating on quack doctors, you're also shitting on the good ones who save lives and help give people skills that transform their lives for the better. And you're making people feel bad for not being as "strong" or as "free" as your online persona proports to be. It should come as no surprise to you that I quit taking my meds when I first started following you early this year because I thought "if he doesn't need them, then I don't either!"... and how did that turn out? Pretty fucking badly, I guess... right? So maybe just chill the fuck out for a minute and stop trying to convince everyone to get off their meds unless you're actively trying to get people to become creepy obsessive unhinged lovesick psychos when their brain chemistry jumps off the deep end. https://www.reddit.com/r/billwurtz/comments/9h5zc7/whoa/ what i meant to say was, the term "ADHD" seems pretty offensive to me, because i think the D stands for disorder, and i get very sad when i hear about how common it is for school kids to be told something is wrong with them just for being disinterested in uninteresting material. that would be kind of like making a movie and then telling the audience there's something wrong with them if they were bored by it ..... but i saw quite a bit of back lash for the thing i said, which i didn't even explain clearly, what you're saying is not what i said nor meant, and i felt terrible and so i've concluded that the whole thing is definitely none of my business

041922.question: Hey, I know this isn't a question but I'm sorry for any backlash you are getting for that comment about ADHD and that asshole who's stalking you. I was prescribed adderall and a cocktail of other drugs to "combat" my "ADHD" which I turned out not to have. The shit they gave me made me someone else. On top of the doctor doubling and tripling the doses of the drugs made me lose 75% of my friends in Elementary school, which I didn't even really recover from until High school. Irritable, unwilling to stop tasks, violent, the stuff they "medically" prescribed me made me lose all trust in "doctors". Sorry about the use of " " marks and clogging up your question page but that guy talking shit about you really activated my almonds and I felt like I needed to defend my favorite artist.

041934.question: As far as I can recall, none of your songs have had a fading outro vamp before "Mount St. Helens is about to Blow Up". Was this just a particular stylistic choice for this song, or was it done in the interest of saving time due to your extremely tight production schedule?
041934.answer: we could just get high does it was a natural chain reaction from the 'special' line actually the opposite. it had a devastating effect on the time. was ready to wrap it up at 2 minutes with a tiny last verse, but then it hits the 'special' line which sends it tumbling into a perpetual outvamp which never wants to end. then i check the time at the end and it's 3min15, and it's sunday. i was 3 days behind compared to last time (due to business trip) and now as an extra surprise the song just spontaneously wrote itself over 3 minutes when i thought i was gonna get out at 2. the previous song was 2:21 and it was nearly impossible in 14 days. now i gotta do 3:15 in 9? 'ok sure what' is what i believe i said to myself

041937.question: hey so you were wondering if the gift shop of mt. st. helens is still "there" but I'm curious if you thought the chord on "there" was too regular as just a little 2 5, since the picture being painted is kind of distant and longing, where as the chord is very straightforward feeling. Though at the same time i understand your choice within the context of the piece and the time limit. curious if you have any tidbits
041937.answer: not exactly normal, it slips into a strange key the first way it came to me was as it is. when i went to work out the details, i refined it to actually be F over Bb (on "there") was more shiny and exotic that way, and seemed cool because that would actually make it nearly exactly how it happened on "grey" at the same time in the first verse except a half step higher. so i thought that would be the right answer, but then upon run-through in wider context it instantly felt wrong, and it was immediately clear that the way i first had it was better so i switched it back. sometimes what seems to work up close just doesn't work in the real time flow of the song in wider context. that's why full run throughs (like from the beginning) are so important, and the only way to find out what's really gonna work

041960.question: Hey Bill, I've been reading through the past week or so of questions and answers and I have noticed a trend in how you answer questions, and I assume it is completely intentional and an extension of the persona that you display in your songs, which in itself is cool and honestly pretty damn endearing due to the sideways and sometimes really succinct and brief ways you answer most complex questions/comments that I or most other people would elaborate upon. My guess for why you rarely elaborate on any answer you give (especially in regards to questions about you or your music) is because you either want people to figure it out for themselves or its just personal and (I assume) you don't want to divulge that information about yourself, both of which are respectable and genuine reasons. However as someone who just wants to know whats going on inside that brilliant brain of yours, it drives me absolutely insane! You so very clearly have ideas you want to convey a nd messages you want to communicate with everyone, and about 80% of these questions have genuine answers about motivation, attitude and inspiration, all of which are actually GREAT advice! If possible could you give an explanation of a lot of the motivation behind your songs? or at least in some way tell us a message or central idea you want your audience to take away from your music. And don't worry, i'm not expecting a direct answer, both because you're not a very direct person in your responses most of the time, and more so because all great teachers of philosophy and introspective thought never just tell people what they are trying to get them to understand. I really really want a full response so I can understand your thought process. To be more clear, i'm not asking for a "moral of the story" message or anything like that, I'm asking more if there is a method of thought that you live by that leaks through in your songs? Because you have a very unique way of making song s that a lways seems to have deep and intertwining themes. If possible can you walk us through your philosophical approach to the world around you and your attitude towards trials in life as well as your way of expressing this through your music? Don't worry, i'm already expecting on getting goofed on with a one word response, or getting a really backwards answer. I just figured that I might as well try and ask all this stuff. Because after all, where is the harm in asking.
041960.answer: that is to distract you from all the hundreds of other times i have answered those same questions in excrutiatingly elaborate detail i've discovered that songs can unlock some of the deepest powers of the universe the world has infinite power and it's on your side ah, that's true. i think showing can be more effective than telling. even better than showing is if you can get them to actually do it ... or, for a twist, realize they already have done it that could take a lifetime but i am doing it anyway

042216.question: Two months ago I upgraded from a flip phone to a smart phone, irreversibly, and it has been a huge distraction for me in terms of media consumption. How do I discipline myself out of this and back to music production? I'm ashamed of myself.
042216.answer: set some boundaries. first, do you need the phone for anything during music production? if not, then put it in a drawer. if you do actually need certain things from it during music production, then you will have to get used to setting some hard rules about never opening certain apps. the trick to getting used to this is the morning. if you can stay completely out of those apps when you first wake up, it will be much much much easier to avoid them for the rest of the work day, at least until the work day is done

042222.question: what is the most practical way to create a website like this that allows people to access content without any bullshit? i guess i could google a little harder, but the only ways i've been able to make a site is through google, wix, and this other one called web.com, and i'm wondering if you knew a way to bypass those sites and create the site with my own code?
042222.answer: start on your hard drive, just to get the idea. take a text file, save it as plain text (not rich text) put a bunch of html in it, then save it as .html. then drop that into your favorite web browser and pow you have a website, except it's only on your computer. then you'll have to get hosting, which you have to pay yearly for. and then get ready to see targetted ads from hosting companies for the rest of your life, even long after you bought it. you'll also see wix ads telling you 'you need a website why not do it yourself' even for centuries after you already made your own website yourself

042294.question: 9.25.18 9:21 am well when you put it that way i can't really think of a good answer but i sure would like to. i guess the only real consequence is that i just can't get behind some of the things i write. like they don't make me as proud as other things. how can i get the most pride and dumbness from something I'm writing?
042294.answer: well this might not be the only way, but i'll give you an example. in 2007 i wrote a journal entry (or freestyle ramble thing) which sucked. i did this every day but they didn't always suck. but on a particular day in 2007, i made one that really sucked. fast forward to 2015, i'm writing for vine, because i just tricked myself into having to do 7 videos a week, so i needed material. so i started playing a game where i randomly select a day from the past and then check to see what i was doing or saying/writing about on that particular day, and try to write a short vine-able jingle video which matches the way my life is going at that point. i found an entry from 2003 or something that said 'can your life withstand the pressure of the pen' or something, and i thought about it a little and came up with the "Are you the Real You?" jingle. another randomly selected day put me at jan 20, 2011, where i had been fervently studying the emotional implications of different chord sequences, song forms, etc. really was on an obsessive scientific rampage trying to really figure out what is making music tick. so based on this (in this 2015 writing session) i wrote "i'm gonna figure out what everything means." then i did the random selection again and it came up to something from 2007 that was just a page of writing which seemed to have absolutely no creative value, no informational value, no entertainment value, no biographical value, absolutely no value on the page. just a terrible terrible page. so naturally the jingle idea that comes to mind goes like this. ok, next pick. so i do the random date selection again, and the next one that comes up is actually the very next page from the crappy 2007 one i just did. it's the next day. out of thousands of days that could have been picked, the exact next day came up. and it sucked just as much. it was terrible. i think i was at a really useless/hopeless place at that time, which is unusual for me, but that's just the way i was feeling during that time, i assume. another totally garbage page, very similar to the previous. so now i'm thinking (on this 2015 writing session) i'm feeling totally screwed, because i feel like i just did this one. which leads to the only obvious solution which would be this. i think i had a point in here somewhere

042351.question: Do chromatic chords have functions like diatonic chords do? 042358.question: 9.26.18 9:14 am yeah, i actually totally understand what you're saying. That actually makes me feel a lot better about things. Thank you. Now, here's another thing, do you ever feel like something you're trying to do gets "lost in translation/adaption"? Example: I have this amazing short story. One of the best things I've written thus far. There's this playwright competition thing I'm doing for school (two actually). I had this great idea: "Hey, I'm going to turn that short story of mine into a stage play" So, I start writing. And ew. In my head the idea worked so well, but on paper it's just not good. It loses all the stuff that made the original so fucking good. It made me kinda resent the story and avoid working on the script but the deadline is rearing it's godawful head and I'm going to have to finish it even though i don't like it and it just isn't what I wish it was. Oh, another thing I hate ab out it. I'm expected to write a good play but they (the judges i guess) put so many restrictions on it.

042410.question: you say the best way to learn music is to make it and all this stuff about "books dont Z make sound" and just anti learning and pro experiencing but how can you know what a key change is or how to effeciently change a key without understanding the concept through text or reference? 042410.answer: whoa whoa since when is experience anti-learning. experience is learning, the most super learning of all learnings there are no text references that can teach you how to change key and have it sound ok, unless it is a song book and you are already a great reader, in which case it might be almost as good as hearing a sound recording. the only way to confirm if a key change works is to listen to the entire thing in context and see if it works the keyboard is not random at all. all the notes are in order, in a perfect layout there can be infinite methods. just like for writing

042630.question: Hey Bill, I'm the guy who had the problem with learning reading sheet music and playing piano at the same time. Just checking in to say your advice really helped as I am getting much more familiar with it as an instrument first. follow up question, when you are absolutely ripping the keyboard solo in la de da, what are those two semi wheels that seem to make it sound as if you are bending the notes on a guitar?
042630.answer: pitch bend, and the other one. most keyboards have those 2 wheels. the pitch bend wheel is spring loaded and usually gives you a whole step either way (or you can set it different if u want) and the other wheel is not spring loaded, and does different things depending on the instrument but on many instruments it's vibrato. i mostly use it for vibrato, on that particular sound i have it for vibrato. but on many sounds i use it for filter cutoff ("wawa"). very useful, especially in getting your digital instrument to sound a bit more like something 'real'

042646.question: How do I stop failing AP U.S. History multiple choice tests when all the choices seem equally plausible? since you did those history videos that gives you a modicum of authority on this subject, i guess
042646.answer: i know world history overall quite well (i learned it in 2016 mostly) but that's not quite the situation you are talking about. to give you an example, when i was researching the history of the world for the history of the world video, almost every single name and event that i came across was something that i remembered being mentioned in highschool history class (byzantium, ivan the terrible, mohammad, confuscius, roman empire, etc etc etc every single thing) but i had not 1 single idea of when where who why whenst and what Any of those things were, in school. every single thing was mentioned, but like in the wrong order i think, and none of it felt real, probably because i was a teenager and i was still busy learning the present. If you wanna learn that stuff, task yourself with making an entire presentation of your own, in your wildest specifications, not under anyone's direction, where you are supposed to explain all that stuff. then you'll have to just go out and learn what you need somehow. you'll learn it very very well that way. but if you wanna pass someone else's test then i wouldn't know what to tell you ...maybe find their answer key?

042647.question: hey don't let all these people going "why u make song short??" get you down, i thought that at first too but upon further inspection i am now of the opinion that it's just fine. i just love your music so i want it to last a good amount of time i think
042647.answer: the problem is, it climaxed somewhere in the 50 second range. there is really no going forward past that. it would be convenient to assume that i made it short for time constraint reasons, but it's just really not true. that song flings into outer space fast in verse 2, and even further in verse 3. then with the 'church key' line, that's such a conclusionary line, there's just no continuing after that. but i am still second guessing it, and it will not happen again

042859.question: i'm confused about songs that have that little half-step passing chord thingy (i know, i know, use your ears.. but this thing always confuses me and I hear it a lot, and I'm sure it's a really simple concept)... like that bruno mars finesse song with the C# to C7 to Fmin (i think), would that be in Fmin and the C# is a sharp 5? if somebody put those chords in front of you and told you to take a solo, what might you play over that C# chord?
042859.answer: that would be Dbmaj7, Caug7, Fmin9(11). honestly in that situation, over the Dbmaj7, Fmin pentatonic will be all you need. during the Caug7, honestly Bb will be your strongest note. still firmly think of F min but i guess don't really hang on the F note, technically you'd want the E note instead but don't hang on that either. and during the Fmin9(11) you'll probably have strong emphasis on those G and Bb notes and also Fmin. basically the whole time just consider Fmin pent stuff to be your home and the Bb note is gonna be really strong everywhere except the Dbmaj7 in which Ab and C (and F) will be stronger. this is all stuff you can find by just playing in F min and listening to which notes sound stronger when

043105.question: Why the hell does "Take me home, country roads" by John Denver sound so homey? What do you think that is? Is it the slow tempo? The relatively simple harmony? Or is it the fact that country music is generally associated with peaceful landscapes, nature, a simple and happy lifestyle and stuff like that? 043120.question: Is pop a genre or is it just a way to categorize the popular songs of the time. Because I feel like the pop genre specifically is one that has really changed over time. Like if you look at songs from the late 2000s early 2010s and compare them to songs from today it's really a surprise to find out that they're the same genre because they're really quite different. Then if you go further back to the 80s for example you see that they're really different from today's music. Now that I think about it this is the same as with other genres as well. So with that being said do genres even exist? If I'm listening to "closer" and I want more songs like that and I put on a pop playlist I'm gonna be really surprised when something like "wake me up before you go go" comes on because they're so different. So then shouldn't songs not be classified into just genres like pop and rock but rather genres AND their time period like 90s pop or 60s rock. Thoughts? ALSO I've been thinking about this - how do you actually write a songs in a certain genre? Like???? What???? What makes a pop song pop or a rock song rock or a metal song metal (I'm talking in terms of just melody lyrics and chords)? Is it just the production stage in which a song develops a genre? Like if I wrote a song and then made three different versions, one with synths and shit, one with some heavy guitar, and one with some sick beats, would I have one song in three different genres? Or just one song? And if I just have one song what genre is that?????? I'm going crazy. How do you think you make a song a certain genre?
043120.answer: they may seem to exist only when the world is on pause classification systems are endless hours of fun, and yet they always fall apart. which is actually a blessing because you get to keep making more systems you will have to contact the authorities on that one it's your choice when you are filling out the registration form first you must ascertain exactly what the client wants. if they can't give you a reference song to go from, you'll have to be deft at reading between the lines .....

043182.question: I'm having trouble following routines. Can you tell me without entering in too much detail what's yours? I'm intrigued because of your amazing speed at song writing/production.

043229.question: Can you give me a short explanation of 7th chords and diminished/aug chords? i learned to use major/minor/flat/sharp chords while playing pop but jazzy stuff has some unfamiliar chords. im trying to play what you wont do for love right now and its got c#7#9 like what does that even mean
043229.answer: the way that type of song uses the notation system is a bit oblique .... very normal but not a good starting point for learning chord symbols. i can tell you what chord goes there in that song, it's C# in the bass, and you're gonna want B, F, and E in the mid range. but it may not be clear how we get that from the C#7#9 chord symbol. to get the chord symbol thing a bit better, i think you should start in the key of C, and for your first example just play C major chord (the chord symbol for that is just C), and then add a Bb note to it. that is C7. that's just what that is. good starting place ...... when i was young, someone confided in me that C7 is the perfect way to signal you're about to go to the F chord. try it ... try a song in C, and play some things in the key of C and then drop that C7 and bam, the whole world knows it's time to go to F now. i think that's a good starting point ... that's where i started ... i'll never forget when i learned that. changed my life. i still use that principle in almost every song

043375.question: did you try something new with your vocal mixing this time?? i don't know if i just suddenly noticed this, but i could have sworn you never pan your vocals much of anywhere. in when i get older, they're super duper wide. it's awesome.

043388.question: Physical activity seems pretty important to how you get your mood, productivity, and discipline to where it needs to be to do some pretty phenomenal things. (The last series of pairs of weeks has again proved it. Thanks for putting your ideas in my head.) I want to learn how to do the same. I know in my heart and brain that moving my body will have the same effect, but I lack the discipline to even do the thing that I know will help. It has just never been a habit, and so I am less fit and I view it as an "extra" thing that is hard to do and wastes the time I already am not using well enough. Has running/moving always been a part of your life, or if you had to develop that habit, how do I get from zero but stay there once I start?

043409.question: Do you want to get better? Do you think that the Moon is made of Cheese (but I can't taste it) is too complex musically? Do you think that When I Get Older is too simple musically? I love your music and I love watching the journey you're on.
043409.answer: yes it was exciting and refreshing, and fun. the song i was gonna pick instead was of a similar level of complexity as the previous song. it would have been ok but i just felt more comfortable doing something much different. so i did moon cheese instead, and it was a wild ride and i had a wild fun time. but there seemed to be a universal response that the chords were just too strange. i know just as well as the next person to never use chords because they seem clever, ONLY if it actually works in the song and sounds good. i am very serious about this and i would not have done it unless i was sure that it sounded healthy strong and good, and i was convinced that it was healthy strong and good .... threw out many other versions which were not ... i was convinced that what i settled on was good and strong, and i was very excited about it. but, there was a universal response that this was not the case. and they must be right no but the first bridge might feel a little weak lyrically and i wish i put just a touch of reverb on the snare in the second verse oh you are very kind

043562.question: 10.17.18 10:37 i am more advanced than that, (i know what diminished and augmented chords mean) what i meant to ask is how numbers work within chords for example emaj11, whats the diffdrence between that and a sus2, stuff like that.
043562.answer: that's one in particular you will probably never see. but here's the basic starting examples i can give for that: C7 means C, E, G, Bb.... Cmaj7 means C, E, G, B. ... Cmin7 means C, Eb, G, Bb.... there are some quirks here already with the system, but hopefully those examples expose them. Csus4 means C, F, G. and Csus2 means C, D, G... so 'sus' is just a little trick that swaps the 3 out for a 4 or 2. if it doesn't say 4 or 2 then it means 4. so if you see "Csus" on paper that's gonna mean Csus4.

043580.question: can u explain to me how you change the color of just your bass or smaller parts of the frame (like ur hair in 'and the day goes on')??? i don't know shit about animation, just curious
043580.answer: with the bass, just chroma key the red, and check the 'invert' box, so it will get rid of everything except that color. then you'll have to put that layer on top of another layer which still has everything in. then change the color of the one with just the bass. for the hair one, actually what's happening there is i've keyed IN the skin, so everything changes color. that was one of the first times i did this but now i do it all the time, it's the same trick i described with the bass except instead of taking the bass color i take my skin color, isolate it, then put it on top and then change the color of everything else. this essentially allows me to do the wild colors and i still look human

043632.question: How do you find the prime factorisation of 6 digit numbers in your head?
043632.answer: first you check for 3s, then check for 5s, (those are easy checks) then you gotta start checking for all the other primes one by one, from 7 and working your way up. if you rule them all out in order then you only have to go as high as the square root of the number and then you can stop. you can check the primes (like 7 for example) by maniuplating the target number by multiples of 7 until it gets to something recognizably a multiple of 7. there are endless amounts of useful/easy ways to do these manipulations, and you learn more tricks the more you do it

043666.question: Hı bill,i'm a piano player, i started making music when i was 15 years old and i've been in love with it ever since. Now i'm 18 and i gotta decide what my next move will be. I would really love music as a career but i'm on the fence, i have some doubts. I want to either make music as my career or computer science. My family and friends mostly support the computer science, because pay is better and there are more job opportunities but even though computer science is enjoyable, music is like enjoyable x100. 043666.answer: there are many many ways to make a living playing music, and they all may require you to do different things. and they are all a very unpredictable path. it's not like medical school where you just follow orders for 10 years and then you get the trophy ... music is a much more weird and wild career path ...... and many people embark on it and don't find any career at all. it's kind of like magic ...... but if you are crazy enough it should be just fine

043971.question: Hey it's me again, felt like asking another very specific and long winded question about your mental state as it reflects the themes and ideas of you music. The new song "long long long journey" seems to me that it is split almost in half, or maybe thirds if you squint the right way, in regards to theme. The first part is incredibly somber and quite frankly depressing, exuding the feeling of exhaustion and trying to trick yourself into going forward (maybe this is just my personal experiences with depression and feeling desperate to keep moving, but the three lines about how far you've gone and then with the " and it's a long long long long long way back" to me feels more like a reminder that you can't change your mind now. Instead of being encouraging and motivating, to me it feels daunting and frightening that now you kind of have to keep going forward since you cant go back.) Regardless of the first bits, the second part se ems to t ake a more positive outlook, especially with the last line with the "road" being to success. My best guess is that this song is about struggling to stay either motivated with a project or with life in general, that or it could be about depression and a kind of subliminal encouragement to those suffering that it DOES get better if you keep fighting. Those are my two best guesses. What do you think I'm mighty wurtz?
043971.answer: traveling can be fun, because you really get to see what space and time can do. really see what it's made of

044007.question: Hey I need a little advice. My life has been feeling empty and directionless for a long time and I didn't know what I wanted to do with my life. Then I discovered you and I just felt like wow that's exactly what I want to do. Be a musician, songwriter, multi-instrumentalist content creator etc etc. I'm not out of highschool yet and I'm very close to turning my life around but I don't know if it's stupid to pursue something only because of my adoration of you? I can't tell of it's following my dream or taking some obsession too far. Sorry for the long ueqstion
044007.answer: you could try it until you get tired of it. for me, music hit me hard at an extremely extremely young age, then if it ever went away momentarily it would always come back and hit me harder from a different angle. various things have hit me like this at different times, but music has been deeply connected to most of them. what you see me doing today is sort of a natural merging of many many different things i have been deeply obsessed with for my entire life. so if it is not that for you, the worst thing that could happen is you may simply get tired of it. no harm in checking. one time i thought i was going to suddenly learn to trade foreign currencies and make a living off of it. i never thought about doing it before, and never had any experience doing it. i tried it and lost interest after about 2 weeks. but that doesn't mean i shouldn't have tried it
